metadata.purpose: Core mathematical definitions for Conv(ℚ) framework
metadata.usage: Include in Introduction and Foundations essays

definition.name: Convergence Operator
definition.description: Maps Cauchy sequences of rationals to their convergent behavior, always staying within ℚ. The operator returns canonical representatives of equivalence classes.

definition.name: Density Achievement Theorem
definition.statement: If |g(n+1) - g(n)| < 1/f(n), then G = ⟨n: g(n)⟩ achieves f(n)-density at level n

definition.name: Rational Pairing Function

properties.property: Injective: π(a,b) = π(c,d) ⟹ a=c and b=d
Preserves ℚ: If a,b ∈ ℚ then π(a,b) ∈ ℚ

definition.application: Set membership: a ∈ b ⟺ ∃k[b = π(a,k) ∨ b = π(k,π(...a...))]

operations.divide: A ÷ B = ⟨n: a_n ÷ b_n⟩ when B bounded away from zero

definition.name: Conv(ℚ) Continuity
definition.statement: A function f: ℚ → ℚ extends continuously if it maps convergent rational sequences to convergent rational sequences
definition.note: No reference to limits or real numbers required

components.morphisms: Mor(A,B) = {f ∈ ℚ : f encodes arrow A→B}
